derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French revivifier or late Latin revivificare (see re-, vivify)

entry.tran: 使恢复活力;使更加活跃;使更加振奋;使恢复效率
entry.def: To revivify a situation, event, or activity means to make it more active, lively, or efficient.

example.ex: They've revivified rhythm and blues singing by giving it dance beats.
example.tran: 他们为节奏布鲁斯的歌曲中加入了舞曲的节奏，使之变得更加活跃。

means.word_mean: 1. give new life or energy to;

auth_sentence.content: The past year or so has seen several drum and bass acts turn to dubstep to try and revivify their ailing genre.
auth_sentence.res_content: The past year or so has seen several drum and bass acts turn to dubstep to try and revivify their ailing genre.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The past year or so has seen several drum and bass acts turn to dubstep to try and revivify their ailing genre.

auth_sentence.content: Finally, if you want to try to revivify something like a saber-toothed cat, be my guest, but remember "Jurrasic Park".
auth_sentence.res_content: Finally, if you want to try to revivify something like a saber-toothed cat, be my guest, but remember "Jurrasic Park".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Finally, if you want to try to revivify something like a saber-toothed cat, be my guest, but remember "Jurrasic Park".
